cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: near the north coast of the Dominican Republic, about 45 mi WNW of Puerto Plata
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest through the Bahamas, then recurving north-north-eastward along the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina/North Carolina (primary U.S. landfall zone in current forecast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet (not including PA)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northwestern Bahamas including Andros Island, New Providence, Eleuthera, Abacos Islands, Berry Islands, Grand Bahama Island, and Bimini
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast northward through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic, including New Jersey and southeastern Pennsylvania shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Very low (3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; otherwise breezy conditions possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the upper Delaware River/Philadelphia waterfront
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain (1-3 inches) possible late Monday night through Tuesday, leading to ponding and localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential river rise and debris flow affecting terminal operations due to upstream rainfall
